title: Mirrors - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Both mirror arms and lock nut have a left hand thread.
The mirror bosses have an external right hand thread.
Follow the same procedure for both left and right hand sides.
Position the locknut as noted during removal onto the thread of the mirror arm.
Fit the mirror boss to the handlebar clamp and tighten to
Fit the mirror arm into the mirror boss. Tighten by hand until the lock nut makes contact with the mirror boss , do not tighten fully at this stage.
Loosen the mirror arm one full turn.
Position the mirror arm to give rear visibility in the riding position, do not fully tighten at this stage.
Hold the mirror boss as the mirror lock nut is tightened.
Failure to counter-hold the mirror boss will cause damage to the thread and the mirror to become loose.
Counter-hold the mirror boss and tighten the mirror lock nut to
Slide the rubber cover over the lock nut.
